comments.content:
Dorchester Script is close, but the r is wrong:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/dorchester-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203235/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/dorchester-script/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/dorchester-script/")

Parfum is a bit closer, though missing a loop on the b:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/rmu/parfum/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203235/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/rmu/parfum/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/rmu/parfum/")

Do you know what year the sample you provided was printed?

Thank you so much !  
It's perfect
This is Dpape's solve, not mine....

Good find Dick.  
Måns Grebäck has also put these letters into a connected script called Respective [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mawns/respective/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203235/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mawns/respective/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mawns/respective/")  
Don
